revised_title: The Role of Skin in Body Temperature Regulation and Health
tldr: The author discusses the special function of the skin and its role in regulating body temperature. He argues that the skin's function is not solely to reduce or regulate animal temperature and provides evidence from various experiments. The author explains that the skin's function is essential for maintaining health and life, as it helps in the absorption and removal of fluids in the body. He also highlights the importance of the skin's function in preventing acute diseases caused by exposure to extreme temperatures and humid conditions.
